citation.article-title: Burkholderia caribensis sp. nov., an exopolysaccharide-producing bacterium isolated from vertisol microaggregates in Martinique.

p.s: Description of Burkholderia caribensis sp. nov.
Burkholderia caribensis (ca.ri.ben'sis. M.L. adj. caribensis pertaining to the Caribbean Islands, named after the once-indigenous Caribe Indians, where the strains were isolated)
Cells are short rods (1-2 x 0-5 μm), Gram-negative, motile and pleiomorphic in actively growing cultures (LB medium).
Cells produce large amounts of EPS when grown on sugar-enriched agar media (2% glucose, xylose, fructose, sorbitol, arabinose, xylose, mannitol or inositol).
Colonies are about 3 mm in diameter after 24 h incubation on tenfold-diluted TSA medium at 28 °C.
They are white, smooth and mucoid.
No diffusible or fluorescent pigment was observed.
Oxidase, catalase, urease, arginine dihydrolase and pgalactosidase are produced but protease is not produced.

The following are oxidized: Tweens 40 and 80, N-acetyl-D-galactosamine, adonitol, L-arabinose, Darabitol, D-fructose, L-fucose, D-galactose, α-D-glucose, myo-inositol, α-lactose, lactulose, maltose, D-mannitol, D-mannose, psicose, L-rhamnose, D-sorbitol, D-trehalose, xylitol, methylpyruvate, monomethylsuccinate, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, formic acid, D-galactonic acid lactone, D-galacturonic acid, D-gluconic acid, D-glucosaminic acid, D-glucoronic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydr oxyphenylacetic acid, α-ketobutyric acid, α-keto-glutaric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, DL-lactic acid, quinic acid, D-saccharic acid, sebatic acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, succinamic acid, glucoronamide, alaninamide, D-alanine, L-alanine, L-alanylglycine, L-asparagine, L-aspartic acid, L-glutamic acid, glycyl-L-glutamic acid, L-histidine, hydroxy-L-proline, L-ornithine, L-phenylalanine, L-proline, L-pyroglutamicacid, D-serine, L-threonine, DL-carnitine, γ-aminobutyric acid, urocanic acid, inosine, 2-aminoethanol, 2,3-butanediol, glycerol, DL-α-glycerol phosphate, glucose 6-phosphate, N-acetyl-D-gluconic acid, lactulose, palatinose, D-ribose, sahcin, D-tagatose, D-xylose, lactamide, D-lactic acid methyl ester, D-malic acid, L-malic acid, pyruvic acid, N-acetyl-L-glutamic acid, adenosine, 2'-deoxyadenosine, AMP, fructose 6-phosphate, N-acetylglucosamine, gluconate, caprate, malate, citrate and phenylacetate.
Arginine dihydrolase, urease and β-galactosidase are produced.

The following are not oxidized: α-cyclodextrin, N-acetyl-D-galactosamine, cellobiose, i-erythritol, gentiobiose, alactose, melibiose, β-methyl-D-glucoside, D-raffinose, sucrose, turanose, malonic acid, glycyl-L-aspartic acid, inulin, amygdalin, arbutin, α-D-lactose, maltotriose, D-melezitose, 3-methylglucose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, p-methyl-D-mannoside, palatinose, stachyose, TMP, UMP, nitrate, tryptophan, esculin and adipate.
The type strain of Burkholderia caribensis is MWAP64T which has been deposited in the BCCM/LMG Culture Collection as LMG 18531T.
The characteristics of this strain are identical to those described above for the species.
